intro: Centaurea rivasmateoi, commonly known as the Rivasa Mateo's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with prominent yellow centers. Centaurea rivasmateoi is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand saline conditions.
